text:
All the Details on Cardi B ' s Canceled Performances (and When She ' ll Be Back on Tour)

Bye for now, Bartier Cardi.

Cardi B just announced that she’s canceling her summer tour dates to focus on her pregnancy. She’s expecting a baby girl with her fiancé, rapper Offset, which she announced to the world by debuting her baby bump on the April 7 episode of Saturday Night Live.

In a tweet and video posted to Instagram, the rapper apologized to fans that this weekend’s concert at the Broccoli City Festival in Washington, D.C., will be her last performance for a while “...because, you know, shorty keep growing. I be looking like I be moving and everything, but in reality a b-tch barely can breathe... I ate like six chicken wings, and I barely can breathe right now.” Always relatable, that Cardi B.

She also announced she’ll be back for the final leg of Bruno Mars’s 24K Magic Tour, which starts September 7. That means the “Bodak Yellow” singer is bailing on at least eight concerts—including the Panorama Music Festival in New York City this summer—but she added that she’ll still be working on new features, music and “most importantly, nesting.”

Let the mama-to-be eat her chicken wings in peace, okurrr? No Invasion of Privacy here.

RELATED: Cardi B’s Appearance on ‘Ellen’ Is One for the Books
title: Cardi B Cancels Tour Dates to Focus on Pregnancy

meta_data.description: Bye for now, Bartier Cardi. Cardi B just announced this week that she's canceling the rest of her shows after this weekend to focus on her pregnancy. She's expecting a baby girl with fiancee and rapper Offset, which she announced to the world by debuting her baby bump on the April 7 episode of 'Saturday Night Live.'
